content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was good of course.
amazing as a fan of fight club

The description could be more direct, e.g.

> In "Fight Club", when the narrator snaps his fingers, he stops talking and Tyler starts. When Tyler snaps his fingers, he stops talking and the narrator starts.
>
> You are given a conversation between the narrator and Tyler, in which the narrator begins, and a snap is represented as {{*Snap*}}. You must find out who talks last.

Plus, I don't understand: why would no one be talking if no snap occurs, when you say that the narrator is the one that starts talking? Shouldn't the narrator be the answer if no snaps occur?

Goal
* Please change "Snap" to "{{*Snap*}}" and remove the quotation marks.

Input
* Please move the example to Goal section.

* Please delete everything else and add this:
<<Line 1>>: A string [[CONVERSATION]]

Output
* Please format "Narrator", "Tyler" and "None of them" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is excellent and the problem is very good and fast!
Good explanation and good problem! For me, approved!
Thank you so much. I'll make some changes!

Thank you for feedback, I'll use it to upgrade my puzzle!

About your question - the thing is person must to give a name of character who said the last sentence. In case if we have only one sentence it both the first and the last one, so it can't be a conversation. If you think I should change it - please notice me.

If that's the logic behind it, it should be in the description, like a last paragraph saying:

> If what you're given, has no snaps, it's not a conversation, but a monologue! In such cases, you must output {{None of them}}.

Thank you for making the changes.

Input section should contain information about the input only. Please follow the example here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Remember to include line numbers, variable types and variable names.

Hence:
* In Goal section, please delete "Every conversation begins with Narrator's words. I want you to tell me who say the last sentence."

* Then move the following from Input section to Goal section to replace the above: "You are given a conversation between the narrator and Tyler, in which the narrator begins, and a snap is represented as *Snap*. You must find out who talks last."

* Then in Input section, please write this instead:
<<Line 1>>: A string [[CONVERSATION]]

Thanks again.
